rules.one_step_back_forward: The traceability system links raw materials and ingredients (one step back) through production to finished products and customers (one step forward). Traceability records enable complete trace-forward and trace-back within the facility.
rules.lot_identification_required: All raw materials, work-in-process, and finished products are identified with unique lot codes. Lot codes include sufficient information to trace back to source and production date.
rules.lot_code_format_standard: Lot code format is standardized and documented. Lot codes are legible, durable, and applied consistently across all products and packaging levels.
rules.mock_recall_annual: A mock recall exercise is conducted at least annually to test traceability system effectiveness. The mock recall simulates a real recall scenario and includes trace-back and trace-forward components.
rules.mock_recall_24_hours: Mock recalls are completed within 24 hours from initiation to final product disposition verification. Completion time is measured and documented.
rules.mock_recall_documentation: Mock recall documentation includes lot selected, start time, end time, records reviewed, personnel involved, product quantity/location identified, findings, corrective actions, and lessons learned.
rules.rework_traceability: Rework and reprocessed product maintains traceability to original lot codes. Rework is identified separately and tracked through the rework process to ensure allergen and shelf-life integrity.
rules.production_records_link: Production records link raw material lot codes to finished product lot codes. Records include batch numbers, ingredient lots used, production date/time, and quantity produced.
rules.supplier_lot_codes: Supplier lot codes are recorded at receiving and linked to internal lot codes. Supplier COAs and delivery documents are retained with traceability records.
rules.customer_ship_records: Shipping records document finished product lot codes, customer name, ship date, quantity, and destination. Records enable rapid customer notification in the event of a recall.
rules.record_retention_adequate: Traceability records are retained for the product shelf life plus 6 months (minimum 2 years). Records are organized and retrievable within 4 hours.
rules.electronic_traceability_backup: Electronic traceability systems are backed up regularly and protected against data loss. Backup data is tested periodically to ensure restorability.
rules.recall_team_defined: A recall team with defined roles and responsibilities is established. Team members include management, quality, production, logistics, and customer service representation.
rules.recall_notification_procedures: Recall notification procedures define internal communication, customer notification, regulatory notification (FDA, USDA), and public notification methods and timelines.
rules.product_disposition_protocol: Recalled product disposition protocol defines segregation, holding, evaluation, and destruction procedures. Product is not released or destroyed without documented authorization.
